runners.comment: Record of 122 switched to fences this term for new yard; form has substance; solid
runners.name: Push The Button
runners.owner: The 8 Amigos Readers & Wiggy N Skinner
runners.spotlight: Record of 122 switched to fences this term for new yard and the form has received a few boosts; ran well on the figures, albeit no match for winner, in Grade 2 at Ascot (2m3f, soft) most recently; brings solid claims back to handicap level.

runners.comment: An ideal type for this assignment, having performed creditably in C&D events this term
runners.name: Califet En Vol
runners.spotlight: Looks an ideal type for this assignment, having performed creditably on bare figures in a couple of C&D novice chases (good/good to soft) this season; Listed winner over hurdles last term and may still have further progress in him; respected handicap debutant.

runners.comment: Hasn't made the expected further progress switched to chasing this season
runners.name: Quebecois
runners.spotlight: Hasn't made the expected further progress at Exeter (beaten favourite) and Sandown (made errors, tailed off) switched to chasing this term; although it's too soon to write him off completely, others have less to prove.

runners.comment: Challenging when final-fence faller here in November; unbeaten otherwise over fences
runners.name: Jordans Cross
runners.spotlight: Arguably unlucky not to be unbeaten over fences, as he looked a serious threat to Kdeux Saint Fray when final-fence faller on the Old course here (2m4f, soft) in November; that tumble is flanked by wins, latest in game fashion at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft); major contender.

runners.comment: Scored on the Old course here in November; solid second at Aintree since; in the mix
runners.name: Kdeux Saint Fray
runners.spotlight: Raced twice on the Old course here (2m4f) in the autumn, falling on reappearance then gifted a soft-ground contest when biggest threat Jordans Cross took a late tumble; solid second, behind subsequent scorer, at Aintree since; firmly in the mix on form.

runners.comment: Won at Kempton on Boxing Day; this low-mileage 7yo looks likely to improve further
runners.name: Barlovento
runners.spotlight: Ridden out to win the novice handicap chase at Kempton (2m4f, good) on Boxing Day, building on his promising reappearance effort; appears to handle soft ground; this low-mileage 7yo looks likely to improve further over fences; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Ran respectably behind Barlovento at Kempton but is unlikely to reverse the placings
runners.name: Secret Des Dieux
runners.spotlight: Ties in with Barlovento on the Kempton running that took his chase form figures to 134; however, far from certain to reverse the placings, with that rival open to the greater progress; all wins in Class 4.

runners.comment: Justified favouritism at Sedgefield on Boxing Day; this is a much harder task
runners.name: Scorsese
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in Class 4 event at Sedgefield (2m3f, good to soft) on Boxing Day, opening his chase account at the fourth attempt; however, faces a much stiffer task off new mark upped a couple of grades.

runners.comment: French mare who seems more exposed than most of these British rivals
runners.name: Kaline Des Boullat
runners.spotlight: French mare who is 4-21 on home soil, most recently winning a hurdles race under Bryony Frost at Pau (2m1f); chase scorer (2m3f) in October but seems more exposed than most of these British rivals.

12:40.race_name: JCB Triumph Trial Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Finesse) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 4-5 over hurdles but limitations were seemingly exposed here in December
runners.name: One Horse Town
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner who won his first four races over hurdles on varying ground, including a Grade 2 here on heavy; had his bubble burst when odds-on back here in December having been pressurised up front; that perhaps exposed his limitations under a penalty and a similar scenario may await this afternoon.

runners.comment: Untroubled to win his sole start in France and a similar story when odds-on at Kempton
runners.name: Maestro Conti
runners.spotlight: Untroubled to win his sole start in France (heavy; third since runner-up in a Grade 1) and it was a similar story when odds-on at Kempton (good), despite carrying a penalty; completely unexposed, held in high regard by his top team and he's currently 10-1 for the Triumph in March.

runners.comment: Held when falling two weeks ago and before that was tailed off behind Maestro Conti
runners.name: Chartwell Jock
runners.spotlight: Beaten when falling late on at Kempton two weeks ago and before that was tailed off behind Maestro Conti; worthy outsider.

runners.comment: The form of his maiden win has taken some knocks but he's on an upward curve
runners.name: Hardy Stuff
runners.spotlight: Looked far from straightforward on his debut but has improved for the hood and arrived on the scene travelling strongly at Leopardstown (2m, yielding) before digging deep to edge out a solid yardstick with the pair nicely clear; the form of that maiden has taken some knocks but he's on an upward curve; much respected.

runners.comment: Beaten in a small field at Exeter and that bare form leaves him with lots to find
runners.name: Lord Byron
runners.spotlight: Left Aidan O'Brien after just two runs, the best when second in a 1m6f maiden (blinkered); gelded prior to hurdling debut at Exeter (heavy) and came up short at even-money in a small field; the winner couldn't live with Tenter Le Tout next time at Chepstow.

runners.comment: Beat a talented older horse at Newbury and he's in against his own age group this time
runners.name: Minella Yoga
runners.spotlight: Sufficiently impressive in an Irish academy hurdle (soft/heavy) to make £360,000 at the sales; received 20lb off the long odds-on favourite when flooring him at Newbury (2m, good) but that was a notable scalp he took and he's in against his own age group this time; Paul Nicholls considers him one of his brightest young talents; clearly very promising.

runners.comment: Progressive on Flat; impressed on jumps debut and Chepstow was too bad to be true
runners.name: Sonic Pioneer
runners.spotlight: Progressed well at an ordinary level for previous Flat yard and looked a jumper with a future when rattling home by 14l at Kempton in November (good; Flat winner on soft); only 5-2 for the Grade 2 at Chepstow over Christmas won by Tenter Le Tout and hard to believe he gave his true running; retains potential but probably vulnerable for win purposes even if back on song.

runners.breeder: Haras De LHotellerie Meridian Int Seb
runners.comment: The Grade 2 she won at Chepstow fell apart but she might well have prevailed anyway
runners.name: Tenter Le Tout
runners.spotlight: All runs on good to soft; stepped up massively on the form of her Exeter win to stroll home by 7l in a Grade 2 at Chepstow last month; that race fell apart at the seams (market principals flopped) but this filly might have won anyway; couldn't dismiss.

runners.comment: A dual winner over hurdles in France but her BHA mark of 128 looks flattering
runners.name: Miss Des Boullats
runners.spotlight: Unseated when favourite for a chase at Pau on New Year's Eve; a dual winner over hurdles in France but her BHA mark of 128 looks flattering and she will need a career best by some margin to trouble the best of these.

runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner; no knocking an unbeaten start and Jane Williams rates her highly
runners.name: La Luna Artista
runners.spotlight: Merely pushed out to win an Exeter bumper (good to firm) and breezed clear for a successful hurdling debut at Warwick two months ago (2m, good to soft); in a lot deeper here but there's no knocking an unbeaten start and Jane Williams rates her highly; could be a player in receipt of weight from all her rivals.

13:15.race_name: Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Ran creditably in small field for Kempton Grade 2 last time; this is a sterner assignment
runners.name: Boombawn
runners.spotlight: Six of his seven wins have come on good ground, and he's been below par on soft; ran creditably when third of four in Grade 2 at Kempton (goes well there) two weeks ago but he faces a sterner assignment conceding weight to some smart handicappers here.

runners.comment: Has a fine record over C&D; unlucky here six weeks ago; leading contender off 1lb higher
runners.name: Jagwar
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive 7yo; won at this meeting on soft ground 12 months ago and followed up in the Plate at the Festival; extended his run of excellent C&D efforts with an unlucky third six weeks ago, finishing well after making the odd mistake and being short of room; leading contender again off just 1lb higher.

runners.comment: Well held here on New Year's Day and looks the stable's second string on jockey bookings
runners.name: Riskintheground
runners.spotlight: Showed he's as good as ever with a win in an intermediate chase at Newton Abbot (2m5f, good to soft) in October but hasn't repeated the form, including over C&D on New Year's Day; looks the stable's second string on jockey bookings.

runners.comment: Progressive; again finished well when winning at Newbury; even more needed off 9lb higher
runners.name: Booster Bob
runners.spotlight: Tends to finish strongly from off the pace and posted another personal best when winning at Newbury (2m6f, good to soft) at the end of November; a 9lb rise means he'll need another leap forward but he keeps progressing and it's certainly possible.

runners.comment: Beaten when falling in Welsh National; back to more suitable trip but others appeal more
runners.name: Uncle Bert
runners.spotlight: Made much of the running when winning in dominant style at Aintree (2m4f, soft) in December; beaten when falling late on in the Welsh National three weeks later, lack of stamina a possible factor; back to a more suitable trip here but now off a career-high mark and others appeal more.

runners.comment: 5-16 over fences; won at Aintree on Boxing Day; up 3lb and this is more competitive
runners.name: Prairie Wolf
runners.owner: G R Orchard & Mrs J M Gray
runners.spotlight: 5-16 over fences and his win at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) on Boxing Day was up there with his best efforts; made the frame at this meeting two years ago and likely to give his running again, but he's up 3lb for Aintree and this is more competitive.

runners.comment: Hard to knock in terms of consistency and has place claims if putting in a clear round
runners.name: Donnacha
runners.spotlight: Hard to knock in terms of consistency and he again ran creditably when second of seven at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft) on Welsh National day; however, he's prone to the odd mistake and may not get away with them on his first run over fences at Cheltenham.

runners.comment: Two wins this season, including here; creeping back up the weights but in the mix again
runners.name: Triple Trade
runners.spotlight: Seemed to be treading water last season but has taken advantage of some leniency from the handicapper this term, winning over 2m here (soft) and 2m4f at Sandown (good); creeping back up the weights but in the mix again.

runners.breeder: Earl Elevage Marion & Mr Didier Marion
runners.comment: Overcame howling error when winning this race last year; signs of return to form last time
runners.name: Moon dOrange
runners.spotlight: Overcame a howling error at the last when winning this race (soft ground) in 2025; 0-8 since, although he wasn't disgraced here on New Year's Day and he's now only 1lb higher than 12 months ago; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Chase wins have come on good ground/sharp tracks; tailed off last month; lots to prove
runners.name: Hurricane Bay
runners.spotlight: Both chase wins have come on good ground on sharp tracks; tailed off at Doncaster last month; lots to prove.

runners.comment: Good runs both starts this season; pedigree suggests this step up from 2m will suit
runners.name: Javert Allen
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who usually jumps soundly; reappearance fourth at Aintree worked out well and he ran a cracker when second at Newbury (again 2m, good to soft) later in November; now steps up in distance and his pedigree gives real hope that the increased test of stamina will suit; interesting.

13:50.race_name: Glenfarclas Cross Country Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Shock winner of big Leopardstown handicap last month; well worth another go over this C&D
runners.name: Favori De Champdou
runners.spotlight: Fell mid-race here on last month's cross-country debut but quickly bounced back, causing 66-1 shock in valuable handicap over regulation fences at Leopardstown's Christmas festival (3m, yielding); well worth another go over this C&D and evidently in prime form.

runners.comment: Won in good style over C&D last month; up 9lb and today's slower ground may not be ideal
runners.name: Final Orders
runners.spotlight: High-mileage 10yo who took very well to this C&D (good) last month, leading from the ninth fence and beating J'Arrive De L'Est quite comfortably by over 4l; went up 9lb for that, though, and may not be ideally suited by the slower ground today.

runners.comment: Not at best here last month and now a teenager but has run some big races over this C&D
runners.name: Latenightpass
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (soft) in 2023 and was commendable second over C&D (good to soft) at last season's Festival; long in the tooth now and faded into seventh in C&D race won by Final Orders six weeks ago, but it won't be a surprise if he's on the premises.

runners.comment: Back from layoff with two below-par runs in late 2025 and would appeal more on good ground
runners.name: Annual Invictus
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with two below-par runs over 3m2f at Newbury towards end of last year, albeit first was in major handicap; well handicapped on old form and should be fine stamina-wise on cross-country debut but would appeal more on good ground and others have much less to prove

runners.comment: Well below best this season and yet to venture beyond about 2m4f
runners.name: Homme Public
runners.spotlight: Good servant to connections over the years (eight wins; mixes hurdling and chasing) but has not fired on any of three appearances this season, and this cross-country debut is his first venture beyond about 2m4f; best suited by good/good to soft; cheekpieces the headgear of choice today.

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Les Boulaines & Isabelle
runners.comment: Good third over C&D last month, despite jumping left throughout
runners.name: Iceo Madrik
runners.spotlight: Dual cross-country chase winner at Compiegne in 2024 (2m7f/3m3f, heavy) and a creditable third over C&D (good) behind Final Orders six weeks ago, despite jumping left throughout; will be a danger to all if his jumping is just a bit straighter today.

runners.comment: On the downgrade now but has shown a liking for this C&D and is on a tempting mark
runners.name: Tommie Beau
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer who is perhaps best known for his heroics at Cartmel but was in front before running out after the third-last fence over C&D (good) in November 2024; on the downgrade now and his autumn form was underwhelming but he's versatile ground-wise and too well handicapped to rule out.

runners.comment: Did pretty well to finish fourth over C&D last month, having made a bad error three out
runners.name: Placenet
runners.spotlight: Multiple hurdle/chase winner in France/Belgium (various ground); did pretty well to finish fourth in C&D (good) race won by Final Orders last month, having made a bad error three out, and has good claims off the same mark.

runners.comment: Ran big race behind Final Orders over C&D on last month's stable debut; big player
runners.name: JArrive De LEst
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner in France (always on slow ground, twice in cross-country races); unable to justify warm favouritism but still ran big race when second to Final Orders over C&D (good) on last month's stable debut; sports refitted cheekpieces today; obvious contender.

runners.comment: Well suited by a slog in the mud but seems badly to have lost his way; cross-country debut
runners.name: Where It All Began
runners.spotlight: Well suited by a slog in the mud but seems badly to have lost his way; needs combination of change of headgear and switch to cross-country chasing to rekindle his enthusiasm.

runners.comment: Pulled up both starts this season but has some good form over C&D and is well handicapped
runners.name: Escaria Ten
runners.spotlight: Looked out of sorts when pulled up here twice in the autumn (3m1f/2m4f; had wind op in between) and can't be supported with much confidence, but is now 10lb lower than when close fourth over C&D (soft) in December 2024; swaps blinkers for refitted visor.

runners.comment: Gave good account when fifth over C&D last month but others appeal more
runners.name: Unanswered Prayers
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when fifth over C&D (good; also suited by soft) on last month's cross-country debut and is now 2lb lower than when winning last season's Southern National at Fontwell (3m3f, good), but others appeal more all the same.

runners.comment: Won on good ground last month but not sure to be in same mood here; visor removed
runners.name: Some Scope
runners.spotlight: May have been perked up by new headgear when making virtually all in a visor at Doncaster (3m, good) last month, his fourth chase win; still well handicapped on older form but it's hard to predict whether he'll be in the same mood without the visor here, and the softer ground is not ideal.

runners.comment: Regressive 11yo who never looked dangerous when well-held sixth over C&D last month
runners.name: Peaches And Cream
runners.spotlight: Won't fail through lack of stamina but this regressive 11yo never looked dangerous when well-held sixth over C&D last month and is out of the weights today; tongue-tie refitted.

runners.comment: First three stable runs were respectable (2m-2m4f); this is a very different test
runners.name: Miralago
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner when based in France; started off for Georgina Nicholls with three very respectable chase runs towards end of last year (2m-2m4f) but has stamina to prove and is 5lb wrong on this cross-country debut.

runners.comment: Tailed off over C&D last month and effectively 1lb higher today
runners.name: The Big Breakaway
runners.owner: Three Oaks A Rose And An Acorn
runners.spotlight: Smart in his prime but has not shown a great deal this season and was tailed off in C&D contest won by Final Orders last month; effectively 1lb higher today; difficult to enthuse over.

runners.comment: Top-class 9yo; easy winner of Betfair Chase on reappearance; again looks the one to beat
runners.name: Grey Dawning
runners.spotlight: Top-class 9yo, successful in ten of his 18 races; better than ever on his last two starts, winning Betfair Chase at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft) on reappearance with plenty in hand; has run well on both his outings at Cheltenham; again looks the one to beat.

runners.comment: Won this race last year and ran creditably in handicap here on return; should give running
runners.name: LHomme Presse
runners.spotlight: Landed the odds in this race last year (soft ground) and showed a similar level of form when second under big weight in handicap here on reappearance, rallying after losing his place at halfway; should give his running again but has a bit to find on the figures with Grey Dawning.

runners.comment: Last seen winning Kerry National in September 2024; no forlorn hope if ready to roll
runners.name: Flooring Porter
runners.spotlight: Dual Stayers' Hurdle winner; has not reached quite the same level in five starts over fences but he still won the Kerry National at Listowel (3m, soft) when last seen in September 2024, making all and barely coming off the bridle; hard to weigh up after a long absence but conditions should suit and he'd be no forlorn hope if ready to roll.

runners.comment: Not disgraced over hurdles last time; should be suited by this return to fences and 3m+
runners.name: Spillanes Tower
runners.spotlight: Won two Grade 1s as a novice chaser, including over 3m1f at Punchestown in April 2024; no match for Galopin Des Champs in Punchestown Gold Cup 12 months later and he's been campaigned over shorter trips and hurdles since (not disgraced back at Punchestown on New Year's Eve); not easy to pin down but he should be suited by this return to fences and 3m+.

15:00.race_name: Unibet Hurdle (Registered As The International Hurdle) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Triple Grade 2 scorer but faces a stiff task against two exciting types in this field
runners.name: Nemean Lion
runners.spotlight: Seemed to run well in a dramatic Fighting Fifth but was only fourth of five, admittedly not entirely disgraced, last week when favourite for a Windsor contest he'd won 12 months earlier; triple Grade 2 scorer but faces a difficult task against two exciting types in this field.

runners.comment: Christmas performance confirms that he's a hugely exciting jumps horse; remains unbeaten
runners.name: Sir Gino
runners.spotlight: Appears to handle any ground; impressive on chase debut prior to picking up a serious injury; returned from 12-month absence to readily justify favouritism and clock a very fast time in the Christmas Hurdle at Kempton on Boxing Day for a third Grade 1 success, proving that he's recovered well from the setback and confirming that he's a hugely exciting jumps horse who is still a potential champion in the making; rising star who remains unbeaten (7-7).

runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Late faller in the Fighting Fifth; unbeaten previously and still a very promising hurdler
runners.name: The New Lion
runners.spotlight: Has raced only on soft/good to soft; one of two notable fallers in the Fighting Fifth in sole start this term, holding a 1l lead and still not under maximum pressure when coming down two out; unbeaten (5-5) previously and was impressive in the Challow prior to following up at the Cheltenham Festival last season for a Grade 1 novice double (2m4f/2m5f); remains a very promising hurdler and still one with serious Champion Hurdle claims.

runners.comment: Runner-up in this race last year but has the worst chance at the weights this time
runners.name: Brentford Hope
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a handy mark in Haydock handicap last Saturday, bringing record over hurdles to 6-20; has the worst chance at the weights back up in class and seems unlikely to match his second-place finish, which was a realistic outcome at the time, in this race last year.

runners.comment: Won this last year but today's race looks tougher and he's vulnerable under a 6lb penalty
runners.name: Gowel Road
runners.spotlight: Course regular who won this last year (soft); however, today's contest looks like it will take more winning, even before factoring in the 6lb penalty he carries this time around; looks vulnerable on this season's evidence.

runners.comment: Beat Strong Leader to win the Grade 1 Long Walk and he's the one to beat
runners.name: Impose Toi
runners.spotlight: A revelation this season since upped to staying trips, winning a handicap at Aintree (3m, good to soft) and enjoying further success in Grade 2 Long Distance Hurdle at Newbury (3m, soft) and Grade 1 Long Walk at Ascot (3m, good to soft); beat Strong Leader by just over 1l last time and he's produced positive performances on both previous runs here; he's the one to beat.

runners.comment: Runner-up to Impose Toi in last two races and he's the stand-out form danger to that rival
runners.name: Strong Leader
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Impose Toi on last two starts (3m, soft/good to soft), latest when beaten just over 1l off level weights (same today) in the Grade 1 Long Walk at Ascot; his record at Cheltenham is patchy but he ran well when third in this in 2024; on form he's the stand-out danger to Impose Toi.

runners.comment: Won Pertemps Final last March; something to find with principals but return here may help
runners.name: Doddiethegreat
runners.spotlight: Won the Pertemps Handicap Final over C&D (good to soft) at the Festival last March; he has something to find with Impose Toi and Strong Leader on the evidence of this season's three outings but he's been running pretty well and the return to Cheltenham may be a positive; not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: Fifth of six in Grade 2 Relkeel here on New Year's Day but faces another tough task today
runners.name: Kamsinas
runners.spotlight: Some progressive form in handicap hurdles last season at up to 3m and, after two defeats over fences, he reverted to hurdles and finished fifth of six in the Grade 2 Relkeel Hurdle (2m4f) here on New Year's Day; that was a respectable performance but he faces another tough task today.

runners.comment: H'cap wins on last two visits to Cheltenham; further improvement needed but each-way shout
runners.name: Ma Shantou
runners.spotlight: Won big-field handicap here (3m, good) in October and bounced back from lesser run at Haydock to win handicap over this C&D (good) on New Year's Day; won a bumper on soft ground; further improvement needed now up in grade but trainer enjoyed lots of success in this race with Paisley Park and this progressive 7yo is an each-way possible at a track he obviously relishes.

16:10.race_name: AIS Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Classic Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Considerable promise on both hurdle runs; every chance he'll stay this far; leading player
runners.name: Act Of Innocence
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (showed promise on soft in that sphere) who won on his hurdle/stable debut at Newbury (2m, soft) in November before close second at 2-7 there (2m, good) in December, behind £360,000 purchase Minella Yoga who is declared to run in the 12:40; there's every chance this longer trip will be within range and he's a leading player for his top stable.

runners.comment: The Blue Room could be the yard's chief hope but he's 3-3 and is not ruled out
runners.name: Adonedeal
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, good to firm) who is now 3-3 following novice hurdle wins at Southwell (2m, soft) and Plumpton (2m, good to soft); had to work hard last time to justify 1-12 odds and The Blue Room looks the yard's chief hope under Sean Bowen, but this longer trip could suit and he's not ruled out.

runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles; up in grade but open to improvement for stable enjoying excellent season
runners.name: Fortune Timmy
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up (3m, soft) who got back on the scoresheet at Fontwell on Boxing Day to make it 2-3 over hurdles (2m3f/2m1f, good to soft); today's company is much tougher but this prominent racer is open to further improvement for a trainer enjoying an excellent season; not discounted.

runners.comment: Runner-up to No Drama This End in 2m5f Grade 2 here in November and he's a key player
runners.name: Heads Up
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in the Champion Bumper here (2m, good to soft) last March and won on hurdle debut at Listowel before 3l second in Grade 2 here (2m5f, soft), behind No Drama This End who won the Grade 1 Challow last month; this front-runner is open to improvement if settling better and he's a key player.

runners.comment: Won his last two; could progress further but others have bit more substance to their form
runners.name: Kripticjim
runners.spotlight: Won at Ascot (2m3f, good) in November on second hurdle start and followed up in Newbury novice (2m4f, good to soft); went close in a bumper on soft; his jumping may improve and it remains to be seen where his limitations lie, but others have a bit more substance to their form; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Comfortably won Naas maiden; others have achieved much more but he's in excellent hands
runners.name: Open Secret
runners.spotlight: Flat winner who got off the mark over hurdles at the third attempt in a maiden at Naas (2m3f, soft to heavy) last month; others have achieved considerably more but he did it comfortably last time and could continue to improve for his top Irish trainer; not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: Made it 2-2 over h'dles when readily beating useful yardstick at Aintree; high on the list
runners.name: Taurus Bay
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, yielding) who made it 2-2 over hurdles (2m, good to soft/soft) in three-runner novice at Aintree last month; he did it nicely last time from a useful yardstick, who won either side of that defeat; there's every chance this step up in trip will suit and he's high on the list.

runners.comment: Runner-up in Grade 2 at Sandown last time and he might not be far away
runners.name: The Blue Room
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who scored on his hurdle debut at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) then finished second in Grade 2 at Sandown (2m4f, soft) behind easy winner No Drama This End, who followed up in the Grade 1 Challow; open to further improvement and he might not be far away.

12:20.race_name: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made it 2-2 when powering clear for Listed win at Newbury; leading claims
runners.name: Highland Crystal
runners.spotlight: Won easily on debut at Punchestown (2m2f, heavy) in November and followed up in Listed race at Newbury (2m, soft) 15 days later, coming from the rear and powering clear after the final flight; following the same route as stablemate Wodhooh, who won this in 2024; leading claims.

runners.comment: French winner; makes debut for powerful connections and could have very bright future
runners.name: Manlaga
runners.spotlight: Won in ready fashion on debut at Auteuil (1m7f, heavy) last March, when she had subsequent winners behind; this half-sister to smart hurdler/chaser Martator makes her British debut for her new, powerful connections and she could have a very bright future; major player.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; 10l second over C&D last time; others have achieved much more
runners.name: Laysoft
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who has also shown ability over hurdles, most recently 10l second over C&D; however, others in this line-up have achieved much more.

runners.comment: 3-3; today's opposition considerably tougher but remains to be seen where limitations lie
runners.name: Manganese
runners.spotlight: French bumper winner who overcame significant interference to win on hurdle debut at Leicester (1m7f, soft), and she remains unbeaten having scored comfortably at Catterick (1m7f, soft); today's opposition is considerably tougher but it remains to be seen where her limitations lie; respected.

runners.comment: Modest maiden on the Flat and tailed off at Warwick last month on sole hurdle start
runners.name: Sovereign Applause
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden on the Flat and tailed off at Warwick (2m, good to soft) last month on sole hurdle start; she'd be a shock winner.

runners.comment: Second to Highland Crystal at Newbury; 5lb better off here but improvement still needed
runners.name: Tralee Girl
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner who has been placed in Listed races on her two hurdle starts, most recently runner-up to Highland Crystal at Newbury (2m, soft) when beaten just under 7l; 5lb better off with the winner today and can give another good account, but improvement is needed if she's to win this.

12:55.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places River Don Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Narrowly prevailed in similar event at Cheltenham; should improve further; respected
runners.name: Carlenrig
runners.spotlight: Narrowly prevailed in similar event at Cheltenham (3m, good to soft) six weeks ago, building on his Chepstow effort behind Rocking Man; has raced only three times in total and should improve further; respected even with 5lb penalty.

runners.comment: Went close in handicap last time; faces a stiffer assignment upped in class
runners.name: Caughtinyourtrance
runners.spotlight: Went close in Haydock handicap (3m) last time, producing best effort since scoring twice at Cartmel in the summer; faces a stiffer assignment upped in class; visor replaces usual cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Two from two under rules; the Jefferson stable has landed this prize three times
runners.name: Country Code
runners.spotlight: Promising type who has justified favouritism in a couple of races over hurdles since switched to rules, latest in ready fashion at Kelso (2m6f, good to soft); the Jefferson stable has landed this prize three times; strong credentials.

runners.comment: Overall record is 3-6; could go well, being a largely progressive sort
runners.name: Fountains Blenhein
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in small field at Windsor (2m6f, good) on New Year's Day, taking hurdles record to 2-3 and overall strike-rate to 3-6; goes into deeper waters but could go well, being largely progressive.

runners.comment: The only course winner in this field, having defied a penalty here last time
runners.name: Get On George
runners.spotlight: Goes into stiffer company but he's the only course winner in this field, having defied a penalty here (2m3f, good) last time; has largely progressive form and the step back up in distance is worth a shot.

runners.comment: Far from sure to replace Cheltenham placings with the less-exposed Carlenrig
runners.name: Intosomethinggood
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably in the Cheltenham race won by Carlenrig but looks a lot more exposed than that rival and is far from certain to reverse the placings; still seeking a first win above Class 4.

runners.comment: Won by wide margin at Carlisle last time but the form is nothing special
runners.name: Kent De Thaix
runners.spotlight: Scored by a wide margin at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) most recently but the form is nothing special, with the second and third ordinary types; inevitably, faces a much better calibre of opposition upped in grade.

runners.comment: Two from two under rules; trainer has landed this prize three times; promising contender
runners.name: Kicour La
runners.spotlight: Has raced only on soft/heavy ground; close second in Irish point; successful in two hurdles races over 2m4f at Leicester, by an aggregate of 18l, since joining Ben Pauling who has landed this prize three times; very promising contender.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Mondant
runners.comment: Successful at Chepstow, beating Carlenrig, in sole outing this term; big player
runners.name: Rocking Man
runners.spotlight: Solid record in bumpers in the 2023-24 campaign, then missed last season; beat Carlenrig by 3l in Chepstow maiden hurdle (2m3f, good to soft) in sole outing this term; should have more to offer upped further in distance; big player.

runners.comment: Irish challenger who has built up a solid record; possibilities if staying the trip
runners.name: Thedeviluno
runners.spotlight: Irish challenger who has built up a solid record, latterly over hurdles with win at Gowran Park (2m) and second in Grade 2 at Navan (2m4f, soft to heavy); possibilities, provided he shows additional progress upped further in trip.

runners.comment: Has steady progressive form, albeit mostly at about 2m
runners.name: The Last Cloud
runners.owner: B Hague Mrs W Duffus & Partner
runners.spotlight: Has steadily progressive form, albeit mostly at about 2m and his latest effort (in Aintree Grade 1) is open to question as several hurdles were omitted; something to prove back up markedly in trip.

runners.comment: Easy win at Chepstow last time; very unexposed and could make his mark at this level
runners.name: The Price Of Peace
runners.spotlight: Has raced only twice under rules and easily justified favouritism at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) on the latest occasion; very unexposed and could make his mark at this higher level; interesting.

13:30.race_name: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Yorkshire Rose Mares' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won this 12 months ago; poor at Leopardstown last month but big chance on best form
runners.name: Jetara
runners.spotlight: Smart staying mare who won this race 12 months ago (good to soft) in game style and made the frame in three Grade 1s at the spring festivals afterwards; ran poorly against the geldings at Leopardstown four weeks ago but would have a big chance if returning to her best.

runners.comment: Progressive; seemed to excel herself at Leopardstown; not ruled out if she stays this trip
runners.name: Dream On Baby
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive; won Listed event at Kempton (2m5f, good) in November and seemed to perform even better when third to the classy Wodhooh in Grade 3 at Leopardstown (2m4f, good/yielding; 18-1) over Christmas; more to find again and has stamina to prove as well, but she may not have reached her limit.

runners.comment: Consistent; fourth at last season's Cheltenham Festival; ran well last time; very solid
runners.name: Feet Of A Dancer
runners.spotlight: Consistent type; fourth over this trip in the Pertemps Final at last season's Cheltenham Festival and has taken her form to an even higher level this term, winning Listed race at Punchestown and beaten off only late on by Wodhooh in Grade 3 at Leopardstown; very solid candidate.

runners.comment: Better than ever this term, winning C&D Listed race; well worth place in this higher grade
runners.name: Lavida Adiva
runners.spotlight: Reliable (has made the frame on her last eight outings); better than ever this season, too, winning C&D Listed event (good to soft) six weeks ago in impressive fashion; well worth her place in this higher grade.

runners.comment: 80-1 when last of five at Leopardstown four weeks ago; faces another stern assignment
runners.name: Mousey Brown
runners.spotlight: 80-1 when last of five behind Wodhooh at Leopardstown four weeks ago, finishing behind Feet Of A Dancer and Dream On Baby; faces another stern assignment.

runners.comment: Lightly raced but was disappointing on latest start and has it all to do on the figures
runners.name: Pottersville
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo; readily won 2m4f bumper last spring and looked a useful hurdling prospect when winning by a wide margin at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft) in November; however, she was disappointing at Windsor on New Year's Day (last of four; 13-8) and has it all to do on the figures here.

runners.comment: 4-9 over hurdles but made mistakes here last time and now moves out of handicaps
runners.name: Rockola Vogue
runners.spotlight: 4-9 over hurdles, posting a personal best when getting up late on at Ascot (2m7f, good; handles soft) in November; however, she didn't jump with much fluency when a well-held third over C&D last month and she faces an even stiffer task moving out of handicaps; cheekpieces are fitted.

runners.comment: Back to best when rallying third at Sandown; should relish this longer trip; unexposed
runners.name: Thatll Do Moss
runners.spotlight: Probably needed run when only fourth to Dream On Baby on return and she returned to her best when a rallying third in Listed race at Sandown (2m4f, good) three weeks ago; should be well suited by this step up to 3m+ and she won't be inconvenienced by rain-softened ground; still unexposed.

14:05.race_name: Virgin Bet Great Yorkshire Chase (Premier Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Made it 2-2 for the season with narrow win at Ascot; this progressive 8yo is up just 2lb
runners.name: Deep Cave
runners.spotlight: Won big-field handicap hurdle at Aintree's Grand National meeting last April (3m, good) and 2-2 this season, reverting to fences with wins at Bangor (3m, soft) and Ascot (3m, good to soft); it was a tight finish last time but this progressive 8yo is just 2lb higher today; firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: 9yo; better than ever when winning at Newbury; this is tougher but he won in fine style
runners.name: Kings Threshold
runners.spotlight: Three consecutive wins early last year (2m4f/2m7f, good-soft) and this 9yo was better than ever when winning six-runner handicap at Newbury (3m2f, good) last month; he's 6lb higher in a tougher race today but he did it in fine style last time and could be in the mix.

runners.comment: Unexposed novice; possible this trip will be within range; could make another bold bid
runners.name: Josh The Boss
runners.spotlight: Walked over on second chase start then easily made all in four-runner handicap here (2m3f, soft); another big run from the front when second of five at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) last month; it's possible this new trip will be within range and this unexposed novice could make another bold bid.

runners.comment: Reverted to fences with respectable fourth over C&D; needs something extra this afternoon
runners.name: Joyeux Machin
runners.spotlight: Placed three times in a row over hurdles early last year (2m3f-2m7f, good-soft) and ran pretty well when reverting to fences over C&D (good to soft) last month, finishing fourth of seven behind Docpickedme; however, he needs something extra to pose a serious threat in this warmer race.

runners.comment: Won this last year and also scored over C&D last month; respected given his record here
runners.name: Docpickedme
runners.spotlight: Course form figures read 1P211, the last two wins coming in this race last year (good) and over C&D (good to soft) last month, both off a mark 2lb lower than today's; has also won on soft; respected given his record here.

runners.comment: Did it easily in the Tommy Whittle at Haydock and could take a 10lb rise in his stride
runners.name: Grand Geste
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first two chase starts (2m5f/2m4f, good to soft) before benefitting from the step up in trip to win the Tommy Whittle at Haydock (3m1f, soft) last month; hit with a 10lb rise but he did it easily and he's open to further improvement for a stable enjoying an excellent season.

runners.comment: Return to form needed but he had a big shout when falling at final fence in this last year
runners.name: Walking On Air
runners.spotlight: He's struggled on both runs for this yard but his new trainer may well find the key to him at some point and he was in with a big shout when falling at the final fence in this race 12 months ago; the tongue-tie returns, having been absent last time, and cheekpieces are added.

runners.comment: This is stronger than for his Lingfield win but he had 9l to spare; unexposed over fences
runners.name: Dartmoor Pirate
runners.spotlight: 7yo who produced a career-best to win at Lingfield (2m6f, good to soft) last month, in a first-time tongue-tie (retained) in his third chase; had just four rivals to beat and he's up 7lb in a hotter race, but he had plenty in hand and could have more to offer over fences; effective on soft.

runners.comment: Front-runner; has run well to be placed on last two starts and today's test could be ideal
runners.name: New Order
runners.spotlight: Three wins during last season's first campaign over fences (2m3f-3m, including on soft) and this front-runner has run well to be placed on his last two starts, most recently when just outstayed over Cheltenham's stiff, extended 3m1f; today's 3m around a flat track could prove ideal.

runners.comment: Runs well a lot more often than not; second at Aintree last time; could be in the shake-up
runners.name: Kelce
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won twice last season (soft/good) and bounced back from heavy-ground blip to finish second at Aintree (3m1f, good to soft) on Boxing Day; runs well a lot more often than not and he could be in the shake-up.

14:38.race_name: Tony And Karen's Engagement Party Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Defeat on stable debut took his chase record to 0-7; needs improvement
runners.name: Harsh
runners.owner: M Gowing P Booker & D Jewers
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 6yo; last of five finishers at Newbury (2m6f) on debut for new yard, taking chase record to 0-7; needs improvement to defy top weight.

runners.comment: Best to forgive latest effort; scored comfortably the time before; remains of interest
runners.name: Newton Tornado
runners.spotlight: Best to forgive latest effort (lost his action); solid record in completed starts otherwise and scored comfortably at Bangor (3m, heavy) the time before; may still have more to offer over fences.

runners.comment: Disappointing when bidding to take chase record to 3-3; however, not written off
runners.name: Noble Park
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite, having lacked fluency, at Kempton (2m4f) on Boxing Day when bidding to take chase record to 3-3; however, this Henderson runner can't be written off; bred to stay this new trip.

runners.comment: Ran respectably back over fences last time but this 10yo is unlikely to show progress
runners.name: Pounding Poet
runners.owner: Hft Limted And P J King And Son
runners.spotlight: Five hurdles wins; respectable third at Newbury (2m6f) when belatedly returned to chasing last time but this 10yo seems unlikely to display progress; oldest contender.

runners.comment: Performed well over C&D last time (second chase attempt) and looks interesting
runners.name: Ki Woo
runners.spotlight: Possibly ground dependent, having shown best British form on good; otherwise an interesting contender, having performed well over C&D most recently (only his second chase attempt).

runners.comment: Overcame trouble at Wetherby most recently; may build on that win and improve further
runners.name: Chasingouttheblues
runners.owner: CW Racing Club & Ursa Major Racing
runners.spotlight: Overcame being hampered by the fall of As Legends Have It at Wetherby (3m, soft) most recently, opening his chase account at the fourth attempt; may build on that win and improve further.

runners.comment: Faller when favourite last time; consistent otherwise; possible danger with a clear round
runners.name: As Legends Have It
runners.spotlight: Started favourite for the Wetherby event won by Chasingouttheblues, only to fall four out; consistent otherwise and looks a possible danger with a clear round in this third chase attempt.

runners.comment: Record of 2211 since switched to chasing; respected with further progress plausible
runners.name: Paddy OMahler
runners.spotlight: Record of 2211 since switched to chasing, proving suited by the return of cheekpieces in gaining the two wins, latest at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft); respected with further progress plausible.

15:13.race_name: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Still on a difficult mark but is interesting back at Doncaster, being 1-1 here (last win)
runners.name: Brookie
runners.spotlight: Still on a difficult mark having been punished for his Grade 1 effort last spring; failed to show his form at Ascot most recently; however, looks interesting back at Doncaster, being 1-1 here (last win).

runners.breeder: A De La Motte Saint Pierre Et Al
runners.comment: Landed this race 12 months ago but is on a much higher mark now
runners.name: Petit Tonnerre
runners.spotlight: Beaten long way when last seen but otherwise a fairly useful chaser who won this race 12 months ago and a competitive affair at the Punchestown festival; admittedly on a much higher mark now.

runners.comment: Strong form at Newbury since switched to fences; may well have more to offer; respected
runners.name: Mighty Bandit
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdles winner; very solid form at Newbury (2m, good to soft) since switched to fences, finishing a good second (behind subsequent Grade 2 scorer) prior to going one better in a race that is working out nicely; may well have more to offer in this sphere and warrants major respect.

runners.comment: Back in better form last time but continues to carry risk, being a quirky sort
runners.name: Harpers Brook
runners.spotlight: Back in better form, albeit wilted a bit late on, at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) last time and remains below last winning mark but continues to carry risk, being a quirky sort.

runners.comment: Record of 2-3 this term but was rather fortuitous at Haydock most recently
runners.name: Grain dOudairies
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 this term but was rather fortuitous at Haydock (2m4f) most recently, with the runner-up seeming likely to have won but for a late error; no certainty to defy career-high mark.

runners.comment: Successful in this contest two years ago but performed poorly in latest start
runners.name: Gabriels Getaway
runners.spotlight: Successful (off 7lb lower) in this contest two years ago but needs to rebound, having performed poorly in latest start; chance partly depends on how well he reacts to added blinkers.

runners.comment: Clear best effort for new yard when close second at Doncaster on penultimate start
runners.name: Here Comes Georgie
runners.spotlight: Has done his winning at about 2m; clear best effort for new yard when close second at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) on penultimate start; place possibilities, provided that form is reproduced.

runners.comment: Opened his account in Ludlow contest last time; may well improve further over fences
runners.name: Milan Tino
runners.spotlight: Opened his account in Ludlow contest (2m, good to soft; second chase attempt) most recently; may well build on that success and improve further over fences; upped in class but receives plenty of weight all round; interesting contender.

15:48.race_name: Virgin Bet Open National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Satisfactory start when fifth to promising type at Aintree on Boxing Day; should do better
runners.name: Capital House
runners.spotlight: Made a satisfactory start when 13l fifth of eight to a promising type at Aintree (good to soft; 12-1) on Boxing Day, and should do better.

runners.breeder: Haras De La Haie Neuve & S Bouvier
runners.comment: Stable has the odd bumper winner; Brian Hughes is a positive booking; worth a market check
runners.name: Country Pursuits
runners.spotlight: 28,000euros 3yo; half-brother to winners Homme D'Un Soir (bumper and 2m-2m1f hurdle/chase) and For Friendship (French 9.7f 2yo/1m2f Flat and 2m1f hurdle); dam French 1m/1m1f winner (inc 2yo); stable has the odd bumper winner and Brian Hughes is a positive jockey booking; worth a market check.

runners.comment: Leading stable has a one-in-five strike-rate in bumpers; interesting newcomer
runners.name: Diamond Street
runners.spotlight: 11,500euros foal; by Diamond Boy; dam bumper/2m1f hurdle winner, out of sister to St Leger winner Bob's Return; leading stable has a one-in-five strike-rate in bumpers; interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Home-bred 5yo; stable's strike-rate in bumpers has decreased in recent years
runners.name: Dukeboxrock
runners.spotlight: By Frontiersman; dam 2m4f/3m hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Pressurise (useful 2m-2m3f chase) and Special Token (bumper and 2m hurdle/2m3f chase); home-bred 5yo; yard's strike-rate in bumpers has decreased in recent years.

runners.comment: Signs of ability in Irish point and Hereford bumper; looks first string on jockey bookings
runners.name: Final Surprise
runners.spotlight: Bought for £40,000 after 6l defeat in Irish point; beaten nearly double that distance in bumper at Hereford (good ground; 14-1) in November, fading; looks the stable's first string on jockey bookings.

runners.comment: Close second of four at Newton Abbot, then left Tom Lacey; that form's not easy to assess
runners.name: Hobbsons Day
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to five French Flat winners (one useful); not beaten far when second of four at Newton Abbot (dictated steady pace; 11-4) in October, then left Tom Lacey; that form's not easy to assess.

runners.comment: Went off 125-1 and showed little at Wetherby just after Christmas
runners.name: Marble Sky
runners.spotlight: Went off 125-1 and showed little at Wetherby just after Christmas.

runners.comment: Shaped nicely when third of five at Market Rasen, just flattening out; high on the list
runners.name: Popalot
runners.spotlight: Dam won a bumper and this one shaped nicely when third of five at Market Rasen (10-1) in November, making a promising move that just flattened out; should improve and high on the list.

runners.comment: Beat odds-on favourite in Irish point; new trainer has impressive record in bumpers
runners.name: Elderflower Tonic
runners.spotlight: Floored the odds-on favourite on second Irish point start; picked up for £80,000 since; interesting runner on rules debut for trainer with impressive record in bumpers.

runners.comment: Improved on debut form when third at Hereford just before Christmas; in the mix
runners.name: Twenties Icon
runners.spotlight: Improved a bit on debut form when third of 12 at Hereford (soft) just before Christmas; open to further progress and should be thereabouts.

runners.comment: Second foal; dam placed in point/2m hurdle; yard 1-13 in bumpers in last five years
runners.name: Ebony Ebbs
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam placed in point/2m hurdle, half-sister to winners Provo (useful 2m5f hurdle) and Clubs Are Trumps (2m7f/3m chase); yard 1-13 in bumpers in last five years.

12:47.race_name: Grace And Dotty Country Clothing Conditional Jockeys' Training Series Handicap Hurdle (Part Of REI)

runners.comment: Placed in higher-grade race at Haydock last month and conditions will suit here
runners.name: El Jefe
runners.spotlight: Last season was a struggle but he was placed on both outings this term, more recently when finishing well to take second at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft) last month; eased in grade today and will be fine over today's trip on slow ground; usually ridden very patiently; good chance.

runners.comment: Creditable second of 14 at Fontwell this month and today's shorter trip will also suit
runners.name: Lexies Moon
runners.spotlight: 2-11 over hurdles; built upon satisfactory seasonal debut when creditable second of 14 at Fontwell (2m3f, soft) a fortnight ago and can cope with today's drop back in trip; obvious contender if in similar form again.

runners.comment: Bumped into a big improver when second over C&D on recent handicap debut; same mark today
runners.name: Kenzoko
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who bumped into a big improver when clear second over C&D (good to soft) on last month's handicap debut; gets another chance off the same mark today and his penultimate run suggests he'll cope pretty well with the slower ground; respected.

runners.comment: Latest run was big step back in right direction but overall profile remains unappealing
runners.name: Lupus Regem
runners.spotlight: Took big step back in right direction when 40-1 third at Leicester (1m7f, heavy) last month but has generally been very disappointing since returning from long absence in October 2024; has first-time blinkers added to cheekpieces today; tongue-tie removed; others preferred.

runners.comment: Ended last year with a poor 3m run and would appeal more on better ground
runners.name: The Longest Day
runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with fairly good third in selling handicap at Newton Abbot (2m2f, good) in September but ended last year with a poor run over 3m and the slow ground here is probably not ideal.

13:22.race_name: Happy 50th Birthday Sara Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Beaten 8l in a 3m Irish point in April 2023; rules debut has been a long time coming
runners.name: All One Word
runners.spotlight: Beaten 8l in a 3m Irish point in April 2023 and changed hands for £30,000 the following month; rules debut has been a long time coming.

runners.breeder: Tommy James Eoin Banville & Lucy Norton
runners.comment: Tailed off in an Aintree bumper a month ago and previously finished last at Market Rasen
runners.name: Bargain Hunter
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in an Aintree bumper a month ago and had previously finished last at Market Rasen.

runners.comment: Had a lot of racing on the Flat (5-57) and stuck on a long losing run
runners.name: Corsican Caper
runners.spotlight: Had a lot of racing on the Flat (5-57) and stuck on a long losing run; stays well but he plies his trade at an ordinary level and isn't overly appealing now sent over hurdles.

runners.comment: Third in his latest bumper but he'll probably need longer trips than this over hurdles
runners.name: Jet Steel
runners.spotlight: Ran okay to be beaten just over 3l in a Perth 2m2f bumper (soft) but he'll probably need longer trips than this over hurdles.

runners.comment: Bought for 25,000euros after making it fifth-time lucky in Irish points in November
runners.name: Jonzac
runners.spotlight: Bought for 25,000euros after making it fifth-time lucky in Irish points in November; would be a surprise winner on this hurdling debut.

runners.comment: 2m Flat winner so has the stamina for hurdling and has joined a respected yard
runners.name: Kingdom Of Stars
runners.spotlight: Only 1-11 on the Flat but his win came over 2m so his stamina is assured for hurdling and he's joined a respected yard.

runners.breeder: M Devilder & Earl Les Obeaux DAnjou
runners.comment: 50-1 and came home last in a bumper at Fontwell (behind throughout)
runners.name: Lancier Des Obeaux
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and came home last in a bumper at Fontwell (behind throughout).

runners.comment: Third here just before Christmas and he kept on quite well once headed
runners.name: Tales Of Bravery
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; tailed off in his first maiden but was better here before Christmas in this headgear combination, keeping on well once headed (on heavy); unlikely to be far away.

runners.comment: Bumper winner on good; 35l off the winner on hurdle debut at Fakenham (soft)
runners.name: Tony Joe
runners.spotlight: Closely related to the high-class Ahoy Senor; his bumper form was on good ground, winning at Hexham and then beaten 13l under a penalty; finished tired on soft-ground hurdling debut at Fakenham where some 35l off the winner.

runners.comment: Beaten about 18l behind a smart one here last time; will stay further but still respected
runners.name: Up To Trix
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 18l and 13l in two Irish points; again well held in a maiden here won by the smart Baron Noir and he's going to appreciate further than this trip in time; still commands respect in a race that lacks depth.

runners.comment: 60,000euros 3yo; prominent to a point but ended up tailed off in his bumper at Warwick
runners.name: Yourcardismarked
runners.spotlight: 60,000euros 3yo; prominent to a point but ended up tailed off in his bumper at Warwick (33-1).

runners.comment: Finished a 7l third at Wetherby (2m3f) despite racing freely; open to improvement
runners.name: Halftheworldaway
runners.spotlight: Bought for 130,000euros after finishing second in an Irish point; looks a work in progress as she was a 7l third at Wetherby (2m3f) despite racing freely; open to improvement.

runners.comment: Respectable bumper form; this is easier than her latest Listed assignment
runners.name: Roses All The Way
runners.spotlight: 0-4 in bumpers but was Listed placed and only real blip came in a Grade 2; well beaten in a Listed hurdle last time (tongue tied after wind surgery) but that was a tough task and she had run well on hurdling debut at Sedgefield.

runners.comment: Half-sister to two winning hurdlers but this is a very belated debut aged eight
runners.name: Seekingrainbows
runners.owner: S L Edwards & S A Hollinshead
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to two winning hurdlers but this is a very belated debut aged eight.

13:57.race_name: Terrible Titties And Other Bitties Charity Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won off reduced mark last February but absent since lesser effort last March
runners.name: Xcitations
runners.owner: G LibsonD BaylissT Davies & P Sly
runners.spotlight: Held on well to exploit much reduced mark at Sandown (1m7f, good to soft; also suited by soft) in first-time cheekpieces last February but was just a respectable third over 2m4f there the following month and the headgear is missing on this first outing since.

runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat at Haydock last month and can make presence felt again here
runners.name: Sunnyvilla
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 11yo who made all at Haydock (2m, heavy) on stable debut in December 2024 and lost out only narrowly in this season's edition of that race five weeks ago (soft); has to take recent 4lb rise on the chin but can still make his presence felt here.

runners.comment: Didn't fire at Haydock last time but previous Cheltenham fifth was very creditable
runners.name: Cabhfuilfungi
runners.spotlight: Never really got competitive at Haydock last month (race in which Sunnyvilla went close) but is now 2lb lower than when very creditable fifth in competitive Cheltenham handicap (2m, soft) on seasonal debut in November; suited by this track; big player if quickly back on song.

runners.comment: Still lightly raced but needs to get back on track after two very poor runs
runners.name: Admiral Stewart
runners.spotlight: Promising as a novice hurdler last season but, following a walkover in November, his last two chase runs were very disappointing; still has plenty of time to get career back on track but arrives with a point to prove.

runners.comment: Drew clear for comfortable success at Taunton last week, his fourth win since November
runners.name: Jaipaletemps
runners.spotlight: Very progressive 7yo who came from off the pace for ready success at Taunton (2m, good to soft) a week ago and has now won four of his last five; will be fine on the slower ground here and the return to a left-handed track won't be a problem either; commands respect in current mood.

14:32.race_name: AP Summit Saddler Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Good run last season; effective on heavy so softer it gets the better his chance
runners.name: Karuma Grey
runners.spotlight: 100-1 winner of a 2m5f handicap chase at Ffos Las last season (on heavy) and returned to form in the new cheekpieces when second back there two weeks ago; the softer it gets the better his chance.

runners.comment: Bled when tried fences once before; recently won over hurdles and just 3lb higher
runners.name: Kamaxos
runners.spotlight: Bled from the nose when pulled up in his only previous attempt at chasing in November 2024; inconsistent profile over hurdles but did win his penultimate race off just 3lb lower.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Ma
runners.comment: His 4th at Wetherby in this new headgear combination was a step in the right direction
runners.name: Abbeydale
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden hurdle in Ireland back in March 2023; hasn't seen much action in the meantime and latest fourth at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in this new headgear combination was a step back in the right direction; possible.

runners.comment: Struggled last time at Haydock but headed there in a fine run of form
runners.name: Master Breffni
runners.spotlight: Struggled last time at Haydock but headed there in a fine run of form and he's still on a competitive mark; couldn't dismiss with trip/ground preferable.

runners.comment: Won last April so capable of a big run but he comes with a good few risks
runners.name: Quick Sharpener
runners.spotlight: Won off 1lb lower at Bangor (2m4f, good; also suited by soft) last Apri but has suffered three non-completions since then and was well beaten when he did get round; clearly capable of a big run but comes with a good few risks.

runners.comment: Chance on his second at Wetherby and cheekpieces return; some stamina doubts
runners.name: My Noble Lord
runners.spotlight: This Flat winner added a juvenile hurdle last season; runner-up on chase debut at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) in November and the cheekpieces he wore that day were replaced by a tongue-tie when beaten further at Haydock; now wears both aids and he's of interest, for all that his stamina isn't proven.

runners.comment: Left Olly Murphy for £12,000; at 50-1 was completely tailed off at Ayr in November
runners.name: Clonakilty
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner for Olly Murphy at about this trip but left that yard for £12,000 and at 50-1 was completely tailed off at Ayr in November.

runners.comment: Placed in maiden hurdles; successful pointer who may raise his game now sent chasing
runners.name: Cahiers Den
runners.spotlight: Placed in maiden hurdles from 2m1f to 2m5f and this successful pointer is entitled to raise his game now sent over fences; could be interesting.

runners.comment: No backward step when beaten under a penalty last time; makes handicap debut
runners.name: Orderoftheday
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who added a Bangor novice in November (2m, soft) and posted a higher RPR when beaten under a penalty at Leicester; Lewis Saunders takes off a handy 5lb on this handicap debut and he should stay okay (kept to about 2m so far under rules).

runners.comment: He should come on for his run in an Ayr maiden, especially now sent further
runners.name: Locquirec
runners.spotlight: Placed over hurdles on two of his three starts in France (2m1f, very soft); his final effort there reads well and he should come on for his run in an Ayr maiden, especially now sent further.

runners.comment: Form of his Warwick third has worked out well so interesting here on handicap debut
runners.name: Warriors Destiny
runners.spotlight: Promise in Irish points and during his early days under rules, with the form of his third at Warwick last time (2m5f, good to soft) having worked out well (front two successful since); of definite interest in his first handicap.

runners.breeder: Haras Du Hoguenet & Mr Gilles Le Baron
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after winning a Catterick novice (front two well clear)
runners.name: In The Age
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; beat an in-form rival with the pair clear in a 2m3f good-ground novice at Catterick (under Harry Atkins) and might be on a reasonable mark for this first handicap; softer ground won't hinder him.

runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Never took to fences and was tailed off back over hurdles after a wind operation
runners.name: Galassian
runners.spotlight: Bangor maiden winner last season; never took to fences and was tailed off back over hurdles after a wind operation; now has questions to answer.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 10yo who has been competitive in all his handicap hurdles from 2m3f to 3m
runners.name: Gege Ville
runners.spotlight: A very lightly raced 10yo who has been competitive in all his handicap hurdles from 2m3f to 3m and Haydock last time was a higher-grade race; dropping back to 2m4f is probably a good thing.

runners.comment: This looks stronger than the Fakenham handicap he won but going further should suit
runners.name: Codetalker
runners.spotlight: Placed in points and off the mark over hurdles at just the fourth attempt when the clearcut winner of a 2m handicap at Fakenham (soft); this is a better race but he's likely to improve for going further this afternoon.

runners.breeder: E A R L Du Bois Hue
runners.comment: Runs well now and again but a generally regressive 11yo and others appeal more
runners.name: Lucky One
runners.spotlight: Runs well now and again but a generally regressive 11yo and others appeal more.

15:41.race_name: QuinnBet Daily Free Bet Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Disappointing chaser; never going before pulled up at Cheltenham and now tries a visor
runners.name: Hillcrest
runners.spotlight: The huge promise he showed as a novice hurdle is a fading memory and he's found it difficult to get a foothold over fences following a long absence; never going before pulled up at Cheltenham and now tries a visor.

runners.comment: Close up at Wetherby in his second chase despite the jumping lacking some fluency
runners.name: Pierrot Jaguen
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo; pulled up in his first chase but did well to finish close up at Wetherby (3m, soft; new cheekpieces) given he didn't jump all that well; doesn't have a lot to find with Aboutdamntime and his jumping might well improve with experience.

runners.comment: Handy throughout and just missed out at Wetherby (3m, soft); just 1lb higher here
runners.name: Aboutdamntime
runners.spotlight: Ended up with just one rival to beat when successful at Catterick (3m1f, good) on his second chase start and probably achieved more in defeat at Wetherby (3m, soft), where he was handy throughout and just missed out; solid chance off 1lb higher.

runners.comment: Third at Ffos Las in Oct but comfortably held in his three other handicap chases
runners.name: Madaket
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; his third at Ffos Las in October reads quite well (3m1f, soft) but comfortably held in his three other handicap chases, the latest here; needs more.

runners.comment: Four-time hurdle winner but lacking experience over regulation fences is not ideal
runners.name: Double Click
runners.spotlight: 0-3 in points but 4-18 over hurdles; went close at Exeter in November and it was only ten days later when he failed to fire here; has since had a break but lacking experience over regulation fences is not ideal.

runners.comment: Beaten 6l off this mark in an Ascot handicap hurdle last time; still unexposed
runners.name: Mount Gay Run
runners.spotlight: Didn't last long with Paul Nicholls nor Keiran Burke, though hinted at a future in both yards; ran well in a maiden hurdle on stable debut and again when beaten 6l on handicap debut at Ascot (2m7f, good to soft); same mark here for this return to fences (unseated midrace in previous chase start nearly a year ago).

runners.comment: C&D winner two months ago and the runner-up has done his bit to advertise that form
runners.name: Paper Mill
runners.spotlight: Prolific pointer and very lightly raced under rules despite his age; ground it out over C&D two months ago (soft; 6lb lower) and the runner-up has done his bit to advertise that form; every chance.

runners.comment: Irish point winner and promising hurdle form; can leave his first run over fences behind
runners.name: Jo Coko
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who was close up in two of his three maiden hurdles for James Ewart, both times over 3m on soft; finished last of the three finishers on stable/chase/handicap debut at Newcastle in December (2m7f, good to soft) but it wasn't a bad run; could improve and should be fitter; cheekpieces added.

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Looked as though he was crying out for further when beaten 11l over 2m4f at Musselburgh
runners.name: Kadjar Des Mottes
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdler but did win a point and he was challenging when falling two out on his chase/handicap debut at Sedgefield (2m5f, soft) in November; looked as though he was crying out for further when beaten about 11l over 2m4f at Musselburgh.

runners.comment: Unplaced all three starts over hurdles but makes handicap debut and could be unexposed
runners.name: Eton Mes
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all three starts over hurdles, but he plugged on when 29l fourth of 14 at Exeter (2m, good to soft) two weeks ago and may be suited by today's stiffer test of stamina; makes handicap debut and could be unexposed.

runners.comment: Sole win came over C&D; well held this season but return to Uttoxeter could spark revival
runners.name: Tarbuck
runners.spotlight: Sole success came over C&D on soft ground; beaten a long way both starts this season but he's now back to his winning mark and a return to Uttoxeter could spark a revival.

runners.comment: Some promise in 2024 but little encouragement since and excuses are wearing thin
runners.name: Tech That
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in point, bumper and novice hurdle in 2024; little encouragement since, folding tamely on handicap debut at Doncaster (25-1) last month; still lightly raced but excuses are wearing thin.

runners.breeder: S A S Rouge Et Gris Racing & S C E A D
runners.comment: Well held in 2m hurdles; hopes rest on this step up in distance for handicap debut
runners.name: Thorgath
runners.spotlight: Last of three on bumper debut and modest form at best in three 2m hurdles towards the end of 2025; hopes rest on a step up in distance for today's handicap debut.

runners.comment: C&D winner; two successes this time last year; probably needed reappearance; possibilities
runners.name: Richardson
runners.spotlight: Veteran campaigner with a C&D win to his name; goes well on soft/heavy ground and won at Chepstow and Bangor this time last year; probably needed run when last of five at Leicester on reappearance; more solid than most.

runners.comment: Big odds when tailed off at around 2m; could take off now up in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Walkinthepresent
runners.spotlight: Third in an Irish point in April 2025; triple-digit odds when tailed off in novice/maiden hurdles at around 2m towards end of last year; hard to weigh up but he's bred to be well suited by 2m4f+ and could take off on handicap debut; watch the market.

runners.comment: Four course wins but disappointing here just before Christmas and needs a revival
runners.name: Rock On Tommy
runners.spotlight: Seems to reserve his best for Uttoxeter and he gained his fourth course success over this trip in May (good ground; handles heavy); however, he was disappointing here just before Christmas and needs a revival.

11:58.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2026 Not 2006 Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: Good second on stable debut at Southwell last Saturday and he's respected back in trip
runners.name: Harlington
runners.spotlight: Has a patchy profile but he won twice (1m2f/1m4f) for Joe Tickle last year and was a creditable second on stable debut at Southwell (1m4f, Tapeta) last Saturday; only 1lb higher here and he could make another bold bid back in trip.

runners.comment: On reduced mark but he's finished down the field in last six starts; others preferred
runners.name: Ocean Heights
runners.spotlight: Now 6lb lower than for his two turf wins last May, but he's finished down the field in last six starts and last three have been at this track (1m2f/1m4f); others preferred.

runners.breeder: J Hanly A Stroud & Skymarc Farm
runners.comment: On dangerous mark but he's been well held in last three runs and losing run is up to ten
runners.name: Crafter
runners.spotlight: Won off 2lb higher over C&D in November 2024 but he's 0-10 since and has been well held in last three runs; usually comes from off the pace and he needs to get back on track.

runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton on penultimate run and has claims if he can get back near that level
runners.name: Moonlight Bomb
runners.spotlight: 13th time lucky when justifying support at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) last month; didn't fire back at that track three weeks ago but his penultimate form has worked out well and he's a player if he can get back near that level.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who has reached the frame in both handicaps; in the mix on stable debut
runners.name: Hawaiian King
runners.owner: Aura Racing Dave Brown Joe Lane
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who has reached the frame in two handicaps at Wolverhampton (9.4f) this winter and he didn't get much luck last time; with another new yard now but he still has potential and could be dangerous back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Record of 1-14 and he made a low-key start for new yard last month; down the list
runners.name: Beta Reader
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on best form for Charlie Johnston but he made low-key start for new yard when seventh of ten over C&D last month; may have needed that after a short break but he's now 1-14 and others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Inconsistent ten-race maiden who was beaten 17l at Kempton last time; blinkers added
runners.name: Sands Of Havana
runners.spotlight: First crack at middle distances when respectable fourth over C&D last month but she was beaten 17l at Kempton (1m3f) two weeks later; has something to prove again after that and she's now 0-10; first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Has not been with James Owen for long and needs a close look back up in trip; hood added
runners.name: Rogue Identity
runners.spotlight: Promising third on handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) in November; didn't build on that at Southwell (7f) last month but he's still unexposed and has not been with James Owen for long; not ruled out with hood added back up in trip.

runners.comment: Won at Kempton last spring but he's been disappointing since and needs a major revival
runners.name: Tatmeen
runners.spotlight: Won a Kempton handicap (1m4f, Polytrack) last May but he's gone the wrong way since and was last of 11 at Kempton last month; now back on his winning mark but he needs a major revival back in trip.

runners.comment: 0-17 on AW but was runner-up over C&D last time and has claims if he can back that up
runners.name: Pride Of Nepal
runners.spotlight: Frequent slow starter who is 0-17 on AW but he returned to form with an eyecatching second over C&D ten days ago; on same mark here and has possibilities if he gets a good pace and some luck

12:33.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: The Out Of The Flames Partnership
runners.comment: Went close over C&D in September and he's a big player back in a novice on his return
runners.name: Star Of Albion
runners.spotlight: 0-4 but he's finished runner-up in last two starts and latest was a close call on handicap/AW debut over C&D in September; returns after four months off, but he has a progressive profile and is a big player back in a novice; first-time blinkers replace cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Third in a Newcastle maiden last time but this looks tougher and he's now 0-13
runners.name: Somebody
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden who has finished placed on numerous occasions, including when third in a Newcastle maiden (7f, Tapeta) 11 days ago; should be fine back at this trip but he has something to find on the figures and may have to settle for a supporting role again.

runners.comment: Well held in two 6f runs this winter and minor handicaps will be more like it
runners.name: Angel Summer
runners.spotlight: Well held in two 6f runs (AW) late last year, with a best RPR of 50; this looks another tough assignment and minor handicaps will be more like it.

runners.comment: Well-bred filly but was tailed off on her Southwell debut last month
runners.name: Analeesa
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly but was 28-1 at Southwell (6f; Tapeta) last month and she finished a tailed-off last of 11; ran green after missing the break in that race but she needs a transformation on her second start.

runners.comment: Sets the standard on her best form and needs a close look switched to AW on her return
runners.name: Lovethiswayagain
runners.owner: Mrs Paul Shanahan & Mrs M V Magnier
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden who flopped at Salisbury in July but she sets a fair standard on her close second at Redcar (6f, good to firm) last spring; yard is in decent form and she needs a close look switched to AW on her return.

13:08.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer but she needs improvement back from 177 days off
runners.name: Nebrook Star
runners.owner: J McGivney D Macauliffe & A Don
