runners.spotlight: Mixed form in four novice events on turf last summer, with her best effort a third of five at Yarmouth (5f, good) on her penultimate run; still unexposed and now goes handicapping and but she needs improvement after 177 days off.

runners.comment: Unexposed gelding and he's a possible improver back at 5f on handicap debut
runners.name: Alvin
runners.spotlight: 80,000euros yearling; no progress in three qualifying runs but he ran well for a long way when fourth on Southwell reappearance (6f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; this is more realistic on handicap debut and he's a possible improver back in trip.

runners.comment: Beat a clear second in a Chelmsford maiden last time and she's respected on handicap debut
runners.name: Cool Molly
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the sixth attempt when beating a clear second in a Chelmsford maiden (5f, AW; 7-2) three weeks ago; that was another good effort from this reliable filly and she should have more to offer now switched to handicapping; respected.

runners.comment: Record of 1-9 and has something to prove on return for new yard; tongue-tie added
runners.name: Henrythenate
runners.spotlight: Responded well to cheekpieces when winning a Wolverhampton nursery (5f, AW) in September, but he took backward steps in his final two runs in the autumn; left Charlie Fellowes for 4,400gns in November and been gelded since; record is now 1-9 and has something to prove on return for new yard; cheekpieces are removed and tongue-tie goes on.

runners.comment: C&D winner but she's lost her way in last two runs and needs to bounce back
runners.name: Beach Partee
runners.owner: John & Peter Seabrook And Tim Fisher
runners.spotlight: Won three nurseries in the autumn and latest was over C&D; only 2lb higher than for that success but she's lost her way in last two runs and needs to bounce back; cheekpieces are removed and visor returns.

runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton in October but he flopped over C&D last time; risks attached
runners.name: Mwaki
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough (eighth attempt) when landing a Wolverhampton nursery (5f, Tapeta) in October but he failed to beat a rival over C&D the following month; has something to prove again after that heavy defeat and he comes with risks attached.

runners.comment: Runaway win here on Wednesday and he looks well treated under a penalty; strong claims
runners.name: Far Too Fizzy
runners.spotlight: Has a patchy profile but he improved his record to 2-10 when making all for a runaway win over 6f here (9-5 favourite) on Wednesday; looks well treated under a penalty and should be hard to beat if he can repeat the form back in trip.

runners.comment: 3-8 on AW but she needs to kick on again to defy this mark
runners.name: Mad Unicorn
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-7 on AW when scoring here (6f) last month but she was only third of six at Newcastle (5f) two weeks ago; wasn't beaten far in that race but she needs to kick on again to defy this mark.

runners.comment: 0-14 but she's finished runner-up in last three starts and is respected back in trip
runners.name: Filly Foden
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden but she's finished runner-up in last three starts including on stable debut at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) 17 days ago; that was a bold bid under a prominent ride and she's respected back in trip.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who wasn't beaten far in Class 4 here latest; dangerous back down in grade
runners.name: Toolatetonegotiate
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who was never dangerous here 12 days ago, but she wasn't beaten far against a pace bias in that Class 4 event; now drops back in grade and has possibilities if she gets a good tow into this race.

runners.comment: Resurgent 6yo who is 4-8 for current yard and he's a big player again in hat-trick bid
runners.name: Sams Xpress
runners.spotlight: Resurgent front-runner, who made it 4-8 for current yard when completing a double at Wolverhampton (5f) last month; up another 5lb but that was a personal best last time and his penultimate win was a dominant display over C&D; big player.

runners.comment: Five-time AW winner who may have needed the run on recent reappearance; in the mix
runners.name: Lequinto
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner who scored four times on turf last June-September; reappeared with a never-dangerous fifth at Chelmsford two weeks but he should be sharper this time and he still looks on a workable mark; in the mix.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo but he's finished down the field in three handicaps; down the list
runners.name: Coronado King
runners.spotlight: Landed the odds in Wolverhampton maiden (6f) on stable debut in October, but he's finished down the field in three handicaps since; still lightly raced but he pulled hard over C&D last time and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Dual winner who got back on track with a second at Chelmsford latest; each-way claims
runners.name: Fiorella Princess
runners.spotlight: Won on Polytrack (6f) and turf (5f) for her two previous trainers; well held in first two starts for current yard but she got back on track with a 33-1 second at Chelmsford (5f) two weeks ago; nudged up 1lb for that but has each-way claims again.

runners.comment: Recorded his ninth C&D win when scoring ten days ago; respected up 4lb
runners.name: Micks Spirit
runners.spotlight: Recorded his ninth C&D win when justifying support under a prominent ride ten days ago; up 4lb but that latest form looks solid and he has won off this mark in the past; strongly respected.

runners.comment: Three turf wins but he's 0-9 on AW and has been well held in last three runs
runners.name: Balon dOr
runners.spotlight: Three turf wins but 0-9 on AW and he's been well held here (5f/6f) in all three runs for current yard; continues to drop down the weights but this is competitive and others are more convincing; reapplied cheekpieces replace blinkers.

runners.comment: All wins have been over further and was always in rear over C&D last time
runners.name: Bint Havana Gold
runners.owner: Alan & Christine Bright And John Henwood
runners.spotlight: Has done all her winning in Class 6 events over 6f/7f on AW; last success was off 1lb higher in October but she's not been in the same form since and was always in rear over C&D (40-1) last time; opposable.

14:14.race_name: Midnite Aint Your Grandads Bookie Handicap

runners.comment: More miss than hit recently but did win over C&D off this mark in September
runners.name: The Bay Warrior
runners.spotlight: Recorded his seventh AW win when scoring at Lingfield over C&D in September; more miss than hit since but he is now back on that last winning mark.

runners.breeder: S A R L De Chambure Haras DEtreham
runners.comment: Back to form with bang to make winning start for new yard at Kempton; 5lb rise manageable
runners.name: Sonnerie Power
runners.spotlight: Dropped a long way in the weights during a winless spell with Mick Appleby and returned from a ten-month absence to make a winning start for new connections over 1m3f at Kempton 17 days ago; had a bit up his sleeve and a 5lb rise won't prevent him making a bold bid if in similar form.

runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Course winner; third over 1m2f here last month but only sixth on return visit 33 days ago
runners.name: Enough Already
runners.spotlight: Won three times here (1m/1m2f) before his spell in Ireland and showed the ability remains when third of ten over 1m2f at this course last month; only sixth back here again since, though.

runners.comment: In good form on AW in the autumn but needs to shrug off lesser runs last twice
runners.name: Little Miss India
runners.spotlight: Successful over 1m3f at Southwell in October; placed on next two outings but her run of good form has come to a halt the last twice; bounce back needed.

runners.comment: Hasn't built on promising Kempton third in two runs since but return to 1m4f may help
runners.name: Hebridean Nomad
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m novice at Kempton in September 2023 but 0-10 in handicaps since; did catch the eye when third at Kempton (1m3f) back on AW in November but hasn't built on it twice since, finishing remote third at Chelmsford (1m6f) latterly; the return to 1m4f may help but others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Below par since small-field Southwell win last spring
runners.name: Forca Timao
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of a Southwell handicap (1m3f, Tapeta) last spring but that was a four-runner race and he's struggled since; has plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Turf win last July; some good runs since and might have needed a recent outing after break
runners.name: Bohemian Breeze
runners.spotlight: 1m2f Flat win last summer; come creditable efforts since and might have needed last week's course outing after three months off.

runners.comment: Third over C&D and at Kempton (to Sonnerie Power) in recent weeks; in the mix
runners.name: Voix De Bocelli
runners.spotlight: Both wins over 1m2f on turf but recent thirds over C&D and at Kempton (2l behind Sonnerie Power) show he's effective over further and on AW; should be on the premises again.

runners.comment: Third in AW maiden in late 2024 but struggled badly since; had wind op since latest start
runners.name: Majestic Leo
runners.spotlight: Placed in 1m2f AW maiden for Ralph Beckett at the end of 2024 but has offered little in varied events since; a wind operation since last seen in November needs to have made a big difference.

runners.comment: 0-10 and now goes up in trip with a tongue-tie added; others are more obvious
runners.name: The Sweet Escape
runners.spotlight: Now 0-10; only sixth of 12 when stepped up to the extended 1m1f at Wolverhampton last month and it remains to be seen whether this further increase in trip is any help; also tongue-tied first time.

runners.comment: Maiden and behind a couple of these at Kempton latest; swaps cheekpieces for blinkers
runners.name: Troy Story

runners.spotlight: Record here reads 5121312, with two off the wins over this trip; good second of 11 over C&D three weeks ago and no reason why he won't be in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: C&D win in December and went close back here 12 days ago; should go well again
runners.name: Jackson Street
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D just before Christmas and went close to following up back here 12 days ago; a further 2lb nudge shouldn't prevent another bold bid in his current mood.

runners.name: Roman Emperor
runners.spotlight: Still seeking first handicap win but went close in similar event over C&D just before Christmas; claims on that form but only sixth of seven at Chelmsford (6f) since.

runners.comment: No win since autumn 2024 but has mostly run with credit on AW this winter; thereabouts

runners.spotlight: Can front-run; without a win since landing a Brighton handicap in October 2024 but he's mostly run with credit on AW this winter, including second at Chelmsford (7f) nine days ago; likely to be thereabouts again.

runners.comment: No win since scoring over C&D in September 2024 and only seventh at Chelmsford latest
runners.name: Global Warning
runners.spotlight: All six wins have been on AW but has drawn a blank success since scoring over C&D in September 2024; met trouble when fifth over C&D in December but no apparent excuses at Chelmsford since.

runners.comment: Well beaten at Southwell latest but first and third over 1m here last month;

runners.spotlight: Off the mark over 1m here last month and backed that up when third here (1m again) nine days later; well beaten on Tapeta at Southwell since but respected on the course form if as effective back at 7f.

runners.spotlight: Close second of nine at Chelmsford (7f) last summer; beaten a long way on next four starts but better signs (met trouble)) when fifth in a C&D classified stakes a fortnight ago; consistency hasn't been her strong suit in recent times so needs to prove she can back that up.

15:26.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Has form figures of 21122 this month and he's a big player back in a 7f handicap
runners.name: Secret Road
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 8yo who has form figures of 21122 this month and was a clear second in a classified event at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last Saturday; still looks feasibly treated back in a handicap and his last win was over C&D; key player back in trip.

runners.comment: Made the breakthrough with a last-gasp win over C&D 12 days ago; respected up 3lb

runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough (13th attempt) when cashing in on a reduced mark over C&D 12 days ago; up 3lb for that last-gasp win but he beat a clear second and remains well handicapped on his best form; respected.

runners.comment: Four-time AW winner and has possibilities if she can rediscover her spark; not ruled out

runners.spotlight: All four wins have been on AW, the latest here (1m) in August; no impact on C&D reappearance last month but she may have needed that run and her first three wins were over this trip; has claims if she can rediscover her spark and she's not ruled out.

runners.comment: On reduced mark but she needs to raise her game back up in trip
runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.spotlight: Triple AW winner (6f/7f), who scored on turf at Salisbury last May; now 5lb lower than for that last success but she's not been at her best since and needs to raise her game back up in trip.

runners.comment: Had a near miss over C&D last month but she's struggled in both runs since
runners.name: Chloes Courage
runners.spotlight: Some creditable efforts this winter including a Chelmsford win and a near miss over C&D; still looks feasibly treated on that form but she's struggled in her last two runs and needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Has record of 1-23 and he was beaten 10l at Southwell last time
runners.name: Cuban Fiesta
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his Newcastle win (1m) last May but he's hard to predict and was beaten 10l at Southwell (7f) last time; that took his record to 1-23 and others are preferred.

runners.comment: 24-race maiden and he's been well held in three runs this winter; opposable
runners.name: Faster Bee
runners.spotlight: Well treated on his old form but he's still a maiden after 24 starts and has been well held in three runs (8.6f/1m2f) this winter; has plenty to prove and he needs to turn things around back in trip.

runners.comment: Well held in final two runs last year and has something to prove after 133 days off
runners.name: Ashford Hill
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D on stable debut in November 2024, but that was a shock at a huge price and she's 0-13 since; on dangerous mark but was well held in her final two runs last year and has something to prove after 133 days off.

16:00.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Reappeared with close second over C&D 17 days and she's respected off an unchanged mark
runners.name: Twirler
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner (6f/7f), who returned after 117 days off with a close second over C&D 17 days ago; that was eyecatching from off the pace and she's an interesting contender off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Triple 5f winner but he's been out of sorts in last three runs and has plenty to prove

runners.owner: SBK Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Triple 5f winner but he's been out of sorts in his last three runs and has struggled in three previous attempts over this trip; opposable.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.name: Early Release
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: Back from long absence when making all on stable debut at Wolverhampton; respected up 3lb
runners.name: Betties Bay
runners.spotlight: Back from long absence when making all off a reduced mark on stable debut at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; that was a narrow success but she held off a clear second and a 3lb rise looks fair; respected in her bid to make it 2-2 for James Owen.

runners.comment: Won over C&D in November and was placed here three weeks ago; in the mix

runners.comment: 0-16 but runner-up in last two starts and latest was behind an improver last week

runners.comment: Won over 1m at Kempton in November and she now drops to 6f for new yard; hood added

runners.comment: Completed a a double on the turf course here in August but she's struggled this winter
runners.name: Comedian Leader
runners.spotlight: Completed a double on turf course here (7f/6f) in August but she's not been in anything like the same form since returned to AW last month; revival is needed.

runners.spotlight: 7yo who has form figures of 1121 over C&D and that last success was on his final run last year; up 6lb but he justified strong support last time and he remains well treated on old form; key player.

16:05.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Time Test filly who offered no short-term encouragement on her recent 7f debut

runners.comment: Absent since a disappointing C&D run 358 days ago; fair mark if ready to go; check betting

runners.comment: Not at best in three runs following a Southwell win at Class 6 level; others are stronger

runners.comment: Contender on last year's best but well held in two runs last autumn; risky at present

runners.comment: Her two best efforts have come over C&D but others bring stronger credentials

runners.comment: Latest C&D run was a bit better without suggesting she was one to be interested in

runners.comment: Not running badly here and at Southwell of late but needs something extra to break AW duck
runners.name: Top Gun Tina
runners.spotlight: Won at Carlisle last July and not running badly at Southwell and here on her last few starts, but she needs something extra to break AW duck.

runners.comment: 16-race maiden who drops back in trip following a break; others make greater appeal
runners.name: Toronto Raptor
runners.spotlight: Showed a glimmer of promise here (1m2f) in September but well beaten here (1m4f) nine days later and he's now 0-16; drops back in trip following a break; others make greater appeal.
